project_name: UPM-Hz - YUPS DX2 Circuit 1 Refrigerant Leak
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):rejected by Jayme Feil (2):offer submitted by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: On routine DX inspections, YUPS Room DX2 Circuit 1 was found to have refrigerant oil leakage within the unit
scope_of_work.scope:
Isolate unit
Recover the refrigerant charge (record volume)
Repair known leaks
Pressure test unit with nitrogen
Evacuate to 4mbar
Re-establish the power supply
Recharge the unit to correct charge
Test run the system
scope_of_work.justification: The YUPS Room DX systems maintain the desired temperature for the critical Piller Rotary YUPS which serves DC suites CSB & CSC. It is also an FGas regulation to locate and repair any DX refrigerant leaks asap
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Reduced resilience and in breach of FGas regulations

scope_of_work.problem:
Glazing panel to the end of the Greenford building (TSSG) area towards the car park broken and about to fall out.
This could lead to weather exposure, vandalism, or property theft.
scope_of_work.scope:
Temporary emergency window repairs.:
1. Supply and hire scissor lift.
2. Protect lower windows inside and outside.
3. Carefully remove broken glass and dispose of.
4. Reinstate with temporary timber plywood (supplied by Kyndryl on site).
5. Kyndryl to remove stone flower planters in order for scissor lift to be moved into position.
scope_of_work.justification:
Reduction of weather exposure, vandalism, or property theft.
Also, reducing the possibility of injuries to staff, contractors and the general public.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Glass falling out and injuring staff, contractors and members of the general public.
Reducing damage to the glass panel immediately below the broken one.

project_name: UPM-Supply and replace 2 x Glazing panels
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):offer approved by Eliseo Treutel (3):offer submitted by Eliseo Treutel (4):work in progress by Eliseo Treutel

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
Glazing panel to the end of the Greenford building (TSSG) area towards the car park broken and has been boarded, as per the client’s request
This could lead to weather exposure, vandalism, or property theft. 
Replacing the glass panels would restore the building to the original condition.
scope_of_work.scope:
Compilation of detailed site/task specific Method Statements and Risk Assessments.

• Provision of SSSTS Site Manager.

• Allocation of GLRE Project Manager.

• Provision of 2No Glazing Technicians.

• Provision of all specialist access equipment to include tower scaffold access platform and podium.

• Provision of spider crane/scissor lift/glazing robot – IPATH trained operator, Access arrangements

and route agreed by client.

• Provision of wheeled A Frame trolley for glazing transportation.

• OM information on correct glazing specification to be supplied by client. If no informational available we will include a pre site survey to determine the glazing specification, sample (if required) to be supplied and approved by client prior to installation.

• Provision of replacement of 2No 10,8 laminated defective glazing.

• Remove all the internal external Capping’s, Pressure Plates, and all associated fixing detail.

• Removal of defective Glazing and disposal from site.

• Prepare the aperture for replacement glazing.

• Installation of new glazing into position.

• Re-fit original (cleaned) Pressure Plates and Facia Capping’s.

• Re-fit/mechanically fix the original (cleaned) pressed metal Interface fixings.

• All consumables.

• 1-day site mobilisation.

• Client handover and sign off.
scope_of_work.justification:
Reduction of weather exposure, vandalism, or property theft.
Also, reducing the possibility of injuries to staff, contractors and the general public.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Glass falling out and injuring staff, contractors and members of the general public.

status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):offer approved by Eliseo Treutel (3):offer submitted by Eliseo Treutel (4):sor submitted / draft by Eliseo Treutel

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
Birds are using areas of the Greenford site for the purposes of roosting.
The birds are active in the following areas;
Chiller Plant Room and Workshop one the first floor
 As a result of the above activities there is a build-up of fouling on the roosting areas and the
areas directly below. 
Chiller plant room and workshop on the first floor.
scope_of_work.scope:
Treat all bulk bird fouling and related materials with Biocide, to render it inert, and to disinfect
the treatment area.
Some staining may remain due to the acidic nature of fouling and the length of time
that the fouling has remained on the affected surfaces.
Any injured or young flightless birds found during the works will be humanely dispatched as once
handled they will not be fed or nurtured by the remaining flock and will perish.
The carcasses will also then be treated with Biocide before being removed off site for safe
disposal in accordance with all relevant Legislation.
The installation of 25 mm mesh as highlighted in the Specification below to prevent the
birds from infesting this area.
The 25 mm mesh will enclose the affected area and deny the bird’s access.
This will entail installing steel fixings at every corner and at 500 mm intervals in between.
scope_of_work.justification: This represents a potential Health Hazard as bird fouling contains many bacteria and insects which are harmful to man.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Further infestation and spreading of the bird population within the building.
Health Hazard as bird fouling contains many bacteria and insects which are harmful to man.

project_name: UPM-Hz - Replace STS24 (CSD) A100 CPU Board
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: 25th April 2024 Out of hours call out to CSD Hardwire STS alarm. Engineer found STS24 had general failure alarm. On checking STS log, CPU had rebooted successfully and the STS and hardwire alarm could be reset. Follow up functional test completed, preferred source to standby and back again was completed 29th April with Piller UK in attendance. On further checks with Piller it was confirmed that there have been failures of the main A100 CPU board due to leaking capacitors on units > 10 years old, including one at NHBR during the 2024 maintenance. This unit is 17 years old.
scope_of_work.scope: OEM recommendation to replace the A100 board
scope_of_work.justification: STSs pride N+1 resilience supplies to DC PDUs, no break transfers in the event of the preferred source loss. Replacement of the A100 ensures maximum reliability of STS, minimising risk of component failure
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased risk of STS failure carrying business load
